H0001.definition:
This can be the tent poles which hold
up the tent, the house, as well as the father who holds up the family, the
household. Ancient Hebrew: The pictograph represents strength, the
represents the tent. Combined these mean "the strength of the house".
( masc., / av) Translation: FATHER Definition: A man
who has begotten a child. The provider and support to the
household. The ancestor of a family line. The patron of a profession
or art.
H0001.relationship:
The support of the tent/house.
Edenics: pa - an exchange from a b and p and a reversal of the
letters
H0001.kjvTranslations:
father, chief, families, desire, patrimony,
prince, principle
H0001.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0024.definition:
Fresh young stalks of standing grain. Also the name of
a month in the Hebrew calendar.
H0024.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0178.definition:
The wineskin hangs from the tent pole. A
spiritist (possibly from their mumbling like the sound of wine poured
out of the wineskin)
( masc., / ov) Translation: WINESKIN Definition: A
leather bag that holds wine. Can also mean "medium" as one who
https://www.ancient-hebrew.org/ahlb/aleph.html 1/25 12/4/25, 2:33 PM AHLB - Aleph
evokes the dead, possibly from their mumbling like the sound of
wine being poured out of the wineskin.
H0178.relationship:
As
hung from the pole of the tent.
H0178.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H2968.definition:
The firm standing of the tent pole.
( common, ) Translation: WISH (V) Definition: [To
be verified] A standing firm for what is desired.
H2968.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0003.definition:
The tent pole is pointed at one end and
doubles as a spear which can be used against an enemy to defend (also
a support of) the family.
( common, / a.y.b) Translation: ATTACK (V)
Definition: To be antagonistic or unfriendly to another. An action
taken by an enemy.
H0003.kjvTranslations:
enemy, foe Strong's
Hebrew #: h.0340, h.0341
( masc., / ey-vah) Translation: FRESH.FRUIT KJV
Translations: greenness, fruit
H0003.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0342.definition:
Conflict, opposition, or resistance; overt acts of
warfare.
H0342.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0108.relationship:
An overwhelming abundance of
ash raked in the fire causing a cloud of dust.
H0108.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0181.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0182.definition:
Regarding. Marked interest or regard usually arising
through a personal tie or relationship. A turning over and bringing
together of a thought. Alternate Translations: on account of (when
following the word "UPON")
H0182.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H3966.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0253.definition:
This can be a sigh when searching as when the ox snorts when
desiring food. Relationships: This root is closely related to אה. Ancient
Hebrew: The pictograph represents strength of the ox. The is one
looking at a great sight and sighing. Combined they mean "a strong sigh".
( common, / ah) Translation: AH Definition: [To be
verified] The sigh of one in exclamation out of a desire.
H0253.relationship:
The howling of one searching. Alternate
Spellings: Edenics: ah
H0253.kjvTranslations:
calamity, destruction Strong's
Hebrew #: h.0343
( ) Action: Sigh Object: Hawk, Sigher Abstract: Desire, Where

alas, woe

H1889.definition:
In Hebrew thought, a wall is more than a vertical barrier but
anything that separates or divides. The hearth around the fire protected the
house from the heat and embers of the fire. Ancient Hebrew: The
pictograph represents strength. The is a wall. Combined these
pictographs mean "strong wall".
( masc., / ahh) Translation: BROTHER Definition: A
male who has the same parents as another or shares one parent with
another. One who stands between the enemy and the family, a
protector.
H1889.kjvTranslations:
then Strong's
Hebrew #: h.0233
( ) Action: Protect Object: Brother, Hearth Abstract: Brotherhood
Definition: In Hebrew thought, a wall is more than a vertical barrier but
anything that separates or divides. The hearth around the fire protected the
house from the heat and embers of the fire. Ancient Hebrew: The
pictograph represents strength. The is a wall. Combined these
pictographs mean "strong wall".
( masc., / ahh) Translation: BROTHER Definition: A
male who has the same parents as another or shares one parent with
another. One who stands between the enemy and the family, a
protector. KJV Translations: brethren, brother, another, brotherly,
kindred
H1889.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0162.definition:
A screaming out of pain.
( masc., / a-hah) Translation: AH
H0162.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H8378.definition:
To long persistently, wistfully, or sadly. What is desired,
whether good or bad.
H8378.kjvTranslations:
n/a Strong's Hebrew #: [Found in
names only]
( fem., / ta-a-wah) Translation: YEARNING
Definition: To long persistently, wistfully, or sadly. What is desired,
whether good or bad. KJV Translations: desire, lust, greedily
H8378.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0344.definition:
A bird that flies high searching for food and
screeches as a loud sigh.
( fem., / a-yah) Translation: HAWK Definition: A
bird of prey, probably the hawk, but possibly a kite or vulture.
H0344.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0185.definition:
This root has the idea
of adding something out of desire. Relationships: This root is closely
related to the root הא. Ancient Hebrew: The pictograph , replacing the
, is a peg representing the idea of attaching something.
( fem., / a-wat) Translation: DESIRE Definition: What
is good or bad, that is lusted after.
H0185.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

optional desire. Alternate Translations: whether Edenics: or -

purpose.

mischief, unrighteous

desires Strong's

H0227.definition:
The harvest is a very prominent
"time" to the early Hebrews. Ancient Hebrew: The letter represents an
agricultural implement of cutting used in the harvest.
( masc., / az) Translation: AT.THAT.TIME Definition: A
specified moment or time.
H0227.kjvTranslations:
beginning, even, for, from, hitherto, now, old,
since, then, time, when, yet
H0227.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0410.definition:
The yoke is understood as a "staff on the
shoulders" (see Isaiah 9:4) in order to harness their power for pulling loads
such as a wagon or plow. Hence, the two pictographs can also represent
https://www.ancient-hebrew.org/ahlb/aleph.html 7/25 12/4/25, 2:33 PM AHLB - Aleph
"the ox in the yoke". Often two oxen were yoked together. An older, more
experienced ox would be teamed up (yoked) with a younger, less
experienced ox. The older ox in the yoke is the "strong authority" who,
through the yoke, teaches the younger ox. Ancient Hebrew: The
pictograph is a picture of an ox head and also represents its strength.
The is a picture of a shepherd staff and also represents the authority of
the shepherd. Combined these two pictographs mean "the strong authority"
and can be anyone or thing of strong authority.
( masc., / el) Translation: MIGHTY.ONE Definition: One
who holds authority over others, such as a judge, chief or god. In
the sense of being yoked to one another.
H0410.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0413.definition:
Used as a
function word to indicate movement or an action or condition
suggestive of progress toward a place, person, or thing reached.
H0413.relationship:
A moving to or toward something to be with
it, as the ox moves toward a destination. Alternate Translations:
at; by; for; on
H0413.kjvTranslations:
unto, with, against, at, into, in,
before, to, of, upon, by, toward, has, for, on, beside, from, where,
after, within
H0413.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0424.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0427.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0451.definition:
The fat part of the hind part of a sheep that is considered an Eastern
delicacy.
H0451.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0421.definition:
The yoking together of two parties. A treaty
or covenant binds two parties together through an oath (yoke). The
oath included blessings for abiding by the covenant and curses for
breaking the covenant (see Deuteronomy 28). The God of the Hebrews
https://www.ancient-hebrew.org/ahlb/aleph.html 8/25 12/4/25, 2:33 PM AHLB - Aleph
was seen as the older ox that is yoked to his people in a covenant
relationship.
( common, ) Translation: TAKE.AN.OATH (V)
Definition: [To be verified] The placing of oneself in a binding
agreement to a course of action including a curse for violating the
oath. Also meaning to lament.
H0421.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0422.definition:
The yoking together of two parties. A treaty
or covenant binds two parties together through an oath (yoke). The
oath included blessings for abiding by the covenant and curses for
breaking the covenant (see Deuteronomy 28). The God of the Hebrews
https://www.ancient-hebrew.org/ahlb/aleph.html 8/25 12/4/25, 2:33 PM AHLB - Aleph
was seen as the older ox that is yoked to his people in a covenant
relationship.
( common, ) Translation: TAKE.AN.OATH (V)
Definition: [To be verified] The placing of oneself in a binding
agreement to a course of action including a curse for violating the
oath. Also meaning to lament.
H0422.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0423.definition:
Something corroborated by a vow. A binding agreement, including
the curse for violating the oath.
H0423.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H8381.definition:
Possession of control, authority, or influence over others; physical
might. The power or might of one who rules or teaches. One who
yokes with another. Often applies to rulers or a god. Often used in
the plural form literally meaning "mighty ones," but often used in a
singular sense to mean "The Mighty One."
H8381.kjvTranslations:
God, god, judge, angel, mighty, godly, heathen deity Strong's
Hebrew #: h.0433 Aramaic Spelling: Strong's Aramaic #:
a.0426, a.0430
( fem., ) Translation: CURSE KJV Translations:
curse
H8381.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

The strength of the ox.
( masc., ) Translation: STRENGTH
H0193.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

The placing of the yoke upon the shoulders
to perform a task.
( common, / y.a.l) Translation: TAKE.UPON (V)
Definition: The placing of a yoke on the shoulders, literally or
figuratively, to perform work or undertake a task. Alternate
Translations: agree (when written in the hiphil [causative] form)

H0502.definition:
The yoke of the oxen, the yoke of learning.
An older experienced ox is yoked to a younger inexperienced one in
order to teach it how to pull a load. A thousand, as a large number of
oxen. Relationship to Parent: an ox as wearing a yoke for work
( common, ) Translation: LEARN (V) Definition:
[To be verified] To learn by example in the sense of being yoked to
https://www.ancient-hebrew.org/ahlb/aleph.html 10/25 12/4/25, 2:33 PM AHLB - Aleph
another.
H0502.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

thousand-fold.
H0505.kjvTranslations:
bring forth thousands Strong's
Hebrew #: h.0503
( masc., / e-leph) Translation: THOUSAND
Definition: Ten times one hundred in amount or number. KJV
Translations: thousand
H0505.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0504.definition:
[To be verified]
In Judges 6:15 this word is used for "family". Edenics: elephant
H0504.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0517.definition:
Glue was made by placing the hides and other
animal parts of slaughtered animals in a pot of boiling water. As the hide
boiled, a thick sticky substance formed at the surface of the water. This
substance was removed and used as a binding agent. Ancient Hebrew:
The pictograph represents strength. The is water or any other liquid.
Combined these pictographs mean "strong liquid".
( fem., / eym) Translation: MOTHER Definition: A
female parent. Maternal tenderness or affection. One who fulfills
the role of a mother.
H0517.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0519.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

multitude, populace Strong's

Translations: cubit, measure, post
H0520.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0523.definition:
A binding together.
( fem., / u-mah) Translation: TRIBE Definition: A
social group consisting of numerous families, clans or generations
together. A family lineage as bound together.
H0523.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

that; on condition that. A desire to bind two ideas together.

#: h.0518
( ) Definition: From the firmness of the plant that comes

( common, / a.m.n) Translation: SECURE (V)
Definition: Solidly fixed in place; to stand firm in the sense of a

https://www.ancient-hebrew.org/ahlb/aleph.html 12/25 12/4/25, 2:33 PM AHLB - Aleph

H0575.definition:
The male searches out the female
and approaches her for reproducing (see Jeremiah 2:24). This can also be a
search for the purpose of producing something. Ancient Hebrew: The
pictograph represents the ox. The is a picture of a seed (plant, animal
or man).
( masc., / an) Translation: WHEREVER Definition:
Anywhere at all. A search for a person, place or time. Relationship
to Root: A ship searches through the sea for a distant coastline (of
an island or mainland) in search of the produce for trade. The fig
tree produces fruit that is desirable and prolific, since the fig is
green and blends in with the leaves, the fruit must be searched out.
The searching may result in success or failure. Alternate
Translations: how long (when attached to the word "UNTIL")
Alternate Spellings:
H0575.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

aware of possessing a personal identity in self-reference.
H0589.relationship:

Alternate Translations: me Alternate Spellings: Edenics: I

H8384.definition:

oblong or pear-shaped fruit from a tree of the fichus genus.

is a picture of the mouth and represents any type of hole.

bearing the nostrils on the anterior of the face. Also meaning anger
from the flaring of the nostrils and the redness of the nose when
angry.

H0800.definition:
A fire is made by firmly pressing a wooden
rod down onto a wooden board and spinning the rod with a bow drill.
Wood dust is generated from the two woods rubbing together and is heated
by the friction creating a small ember in the dust. Small tinder is then
placed on the ember and is blown ignited the tinder. Ancient Hebrew: The
pictograph represents strength. The is a picture of teeth and imply
pressing as one does with the teeth to chew food. Combined these pictures
mean "a strong pressing down".
( fem., / eysh) Translation: FIRE Definition: The
phenomenon of combustion manifested by heat, light and flame.
H0800.relationship:
The pressing of wood together with a fire
drill to produce fire through friction. Edenics: ash - as the product
of fire
H0800.kjvTranslations:
fire, burning, fiery, flaming, hot Strong's
Hebrew #: h.0784 Aramaic Spelling: Strong's Aramaic #:
a.0785
( fem., ) Translation: FIRE Definition: [To be
verified] A fire as well as an offering made by fire. KJV
Translations: fire
H0800.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0855.definition:
When plowing a field with oxen, the plowman drives
the oxen toward a distant mark in order to keep the furrow straight. A
traveler arrives at his destination by following a mark. The traveling
toward a mark, destination or person. The arrival of one to the mark. A
"you" is an individual who has arrived to a "me". The coming toward a
mark. A standard, or flag, with the family mark hangs as a sign. An
agreement or covenant by two where a sign or mark of the agreement is
made as a reminder to both parties. Ancient Hebrew: The pictograph is
a picture of an ox. The is a picture of two crossed sticks used to make a
sign or mark. Combined these pictures represent "an ox moving toward a
mark".
( masc., / yet) Translation: PLOWSHARE Definition:
The cutting point of a plow.
H0855.relationship:
The plowing of
a field by driving the oxen to a distant mark.
H0855.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0853.definition:
A function word
to indicate presence or occurrence, a goal of an implied or indicated
action, etc. Commonly used as a grammatical tool to identify the
direct object of a verb. Alternate Translations: by; for; to; with
Edenics: at - a moving at something
H0853.source: AHLB (Ancient Hebrew Lexicon of the Bible)

H0854.definition:
A function word
to indicate presence or occurrence, a goal of an implied or indicated
